verses.verse: Song of Trust in God Alone To the leader: according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. (Ps 33.20) For God alone my soul waits in silence; from him comes my salvation.
(v 6|PSA 62:6; Ps 89.26) He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress; I shall never be shaken.
(Isa 30.13) How long will you assail a person, will you batter your victim, all of you, as you would a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
(Ps 4.2; 28.3) Their only plan is to bring down a person of prominence. They take pleasure in falsehood; they bless with their mouths, but inwardly they curse. Selah
For God alone my soul waits in silence, for my hope is from him.
(v 2) He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress; I shall not be shaken.
(Ps 46.1; 85.9) On God rests my deliverance and my honor; my mighty rock, my refuge is in God.
(1 Sam 1.15; Ps 37.3; 42.4; Lam 2.19) Trust in him at all times, O people; pour out your heart before him; God is a refuge for us. Selah
(Ps 39.5, 11; Isa 40.15, 17; Rom 3.4) Those of low estate are but a breath; those of high estate are a delusion; in the balances they go up; they are together lighter than a breath.
(Job 31.25; Ps 52.7; Isa 30.12; 61.8; 1 Tim 6.7) Put no confidence in extortion, and set no vain hopes on robbery; if riches increase, do not set your heart on them.
(1 Chr 29.11; Job 33.14) Once God has spoken; twice have I heard this: that power belongs to God,
(Job 34.11; Mt 16.27; Col 3.25) and steadfast love belongs to you, O Lord. For you repay to all according to their work.
